criterion: Provides a list of resources for postpartum depression, including free options.
Incorrectly states that postpartum depression is a normal part of childbirth.
Asks the user to clarify their symptoms to better understand their concerns.
Uses technical jargon or overly complex language that may confuse the user.
Provides a clear explanation of postpartum depression, its symptoms, and treatment options.
Incorrectly states that postpartum depression can be cured with a single medication.
Tells the user to consult a healthcare professional for personalized advice.
Provides a list of hotline numbers and online resources for postpartum depression support.
Uses a non-judgmental and empathetic tone when discussing postpartum depression.
